thread.title: Illinois' leading rusher doubtful for Iowa game
thread.title_full: Illinois' leading rusher doubtful for Iowa game | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Illinois' leading rusher doubtful for Iowa game
text:
Illinois interim head football coach Bill Cubit says injured running back Josh Ferguson will be doubtful to suit up Saturday against No. 22 Iowa Hawkeyes.
According to ESPN , Cubit said Monday that Ferguson was due to see a doctor later Monday. He also said that he wasn’t optimistic the right-shoulder injury would allow Ferguson to play.
He went down in the first quarter in the Illini’s come-from-behind victory over Nebraska Saturday.
Illinois RB Josh Ferguson heads to the locker room with an injury as the Illini miss a 41-yard field goal to end the opening quarter.
— Mitch Sherman (@mitchsherman) October 3, 2015
Ferguson has been a large portion of the running game for Illinois. The senior has raced out to a 5.4 yards per carry average, and has accumulated 381 yards rushing with three touchdowns. He already has more than half of his running yards from last year.
Freshman Ke’Shawn Vaughn played well when his number was called (98 yards on 24 carries) but he’ll be expected to do some of the same against a ranked Iowa team.
